results.title: Messengers of the Gods
results.brief_description: The story of the crane and its long flight in the imagination of man. Looks at their migration habits, courtship, mating, nesting and feeding rituals. This is a nature documentary of extraordinary quality with eloquent narration.

results.title: Messengers of peace.- [Rev. ed.]
results.creator_credit: Al Fox and United Nations Television
results.brief_description: This film looks at the philatelic aspects of United Nations’ stamps. The UN has a postal administration and used the mail routes of the world for its won unique international postage stamps. Some of the world’s leading artists prepare the designs which appear on the stamps.

results.title: Message from Moree (A) [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: Judy Rymer, Bevan Childs, Australian Broadcasting Corporation and Rymer Bayly Watson
results.brief_description: Moree, several hours north-west of Sydney, once had the reputation for being New South Wales’ most racist town, particularly during the 1990s. A rich agricultural district of wealthy farmers, Moree also is home to a poverty-stricken mainly unemployed minority Aboriginal community, giving rise to a high crime rate, violence, racism, despair and social disintegration. By 1996 Moree was in crisis with unemployment for Aboriginals at 44% (non-Aboriginals 7%). Dick Estens, a cotton farmer whose passion for the underdog and a refusal to acknowledge or accept failure, set about with a private group of concerned citizens in establishing the AES (Aboriginal Employment Strategy). His mission was to gain employment for Aboriginal people through a process of mentoring and partnerships. This documentary follows the handover by Dick Estens of the leadership of the AES to the Aboriginal community and the appointment of Cathy Duncan, a young tenacious Aboriginal educator, as Chair of the AES. Together Cathy and Dick begin to inspire change in the town of Moree, bringing a new hope of reconciliation between blacks and whites, increased employment for Aboriginals and a more positive attitude and respect between the two cultures. The partnership between Dick and Cathy is an interesting one with suspicion slowly turning into trust, ignorance into understanding, despair into hope and eventually, through compromise, mutual respect and admiration for each other as they strive towards a common goal. An extraordinary story of a small community committed to change. Contains archival footage, some scenes in b&w. For more information see “www.abc.net.au/message/tv/docos/moree/”

results.title: Message from a dinosaur
results.brief_description: Explains how the past is reconstructed from fossil remains, how palaeontologists hypothesise about prehistoric life forms, and how new forms of life evolved from the environmental changes. Organisms which cannot adapt to changing conditions do not survive.

results.title: Mesa Verde: Mystery of the silent cities
results.creator_credit: Bert Van Bork and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: The ruins of a mysterious Pueblo Culture in the American South-West are probed in an attempt to reconstruct the lives and times of these fascinating people, who appeared suddenly, flourished and disappeared just as suddenly.

results.title: Merry-go-round
results.brief_description: A charming and amusing documentary on some cultural aspects of the children of India in the 1950’s. Images include children visiting a zoo, a spring carnival, fancy dress, dancing, Nehru at a huge out-door rally of children.

results.title: Mermaid forest (D)
results.creator_credit: Takaya Mizutani, Isamu Asami, Isamu Senda and Manga Entertainment
results.brief_description: An old Japanese legend states that immortality will be bestowed upon those who consume the flesh of a mermaid. Unfortunately, it fails to highlight the bitter curse of loneliness that comes as one of its side effects. The first part of this story of sadness and revenge is told in flashback, and focuses on Sawa, a young girl devastated by the incurable illness suffered by her twin sister. When Dr. Shina declares there is nothing more he can do, Sawa offers her dying sister the chance to regain her health - and gain immortality - by drinking a flask of mermaid’s blood. Her sister recovers, but partially undergoes a monstrous physical transformation as a result. Over seventy years later, Yuta meets up with a fellow immortal, Mana, and is filled with new hope that his eternal quest for a soul mate is over. Unfortunately, Mana is kidnapped after an accident on a cliff top, and taken to the old Kannagi Mansion, where she narrowly escapes having her arm amputated. Towa, the mysterious white-haired beauty residing there asks her to stay awhile, and unaware of the real reasons behind this offer, Mana agrees. Meanwhile, Yuta has tracked his lost love to the Mansion, but is waylaid by a hideous beast that has been ordered to kill him. Despite their immortality, both Yuta and Mana suffer many brutal injuries at the hands of Towa as her identity and her desperate secret are gradually revealed. Only the knowledge of the old woman can save Mana from the ghastly fate that awaits her. Based on the manga of the same name by one of Japan’s most successful female manga artists, Rumiko Takahashi, a master storyteller whose other works are more generally renowned for their humorous explorations of the human condition and their blend of romance and mythology. This anime is based on the third book in Takahashi’s Mermaid Saga.

results.title: Merlin's magical message
results.creator_credit: Rick Reinert and American Dental Association
results.brief_description: Uses animation to emphasise he importance of home dental care in preserving good dental health. Using animation and Merlins and King Arthur as characters, pints out the importance of home dental care, especially brushing.

results.title: Merlin
results.brief_description: Marvel at the magic of Merlin in this spectacular presentation. Sorceress Mab (Miranda Richardson), summons forth the wizard Merlin (Sam Neill) in an attempt to perpetuate the powers of old. Her surrogate son loses her passion for dark magic when his heart is touched by love in the form of the beautiful Nimue (Isabella Rossellini). Merlin aligns himself with the warrior who will become King Arthur and is able to use his powers for good to bring peace and justice. Wherever there is good however, evil lurks, and a battle is waged between these two opposing forces. Even if you are not a fan of fantasy, the special effects from Framestore and Jim Henson’s Creature shop, as well as the costuming will delight the visual senses. Also starring Helena Bonham Carter, John Gielgud, Rutger Hauer, Martin Short and James Earl Jones. The feature presentation is followed by “The Magical making of Merlin” produced by Russ Patrick.
